storyInfo: Lee suffers an unexpected attack from a Miss Du at the inn he's chosen. With no pause for explanation, the place explodes into chaos, and once the bystanders Kroos and Mr. Nothing recognize Lee, they too are drawn into the scuffle.

attributes.content: The inn has over ten branch locations in Shangshu. Yet, they do not take the name Xingyu. Perhaps Xinglu for a journey fortunate, or Xingfu for a journey blessed—but Xingyu, for a journey plentiful, belongs to this inn alone.

And of course, this inn alone provides such an incredible view of the skyscrapers against the twin moons mirrored in the distant lake at night. The innkeeper paid mind only to the scenery when choosing locations. Not to the guests, nor to the rent.
Fine scenery puts guests in a fine mood. Fine scenery puts all in harmony, and the coin will come whether you like it or not.
Mmm... fine tea indeed, and a fine view.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: First timers should stay somewhere nice. Get a good impression of Shangshu.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Xingyu Inn. An antique, elegant name.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Famous, but it only recently got into food service. The innkeeper has talent, and whatever he touches goes well.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: It's grown to be a lot to handle, but still he...
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Is that him there, busying about?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: The very same.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Doesn't look like an owner at all. Very steady as he goes. You have to admire him.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: If only I knew what my old schoolmate was up to... The Liang boy.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: To borrow your words: steady as he goes.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Is he a good mandarin?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Ask any passerby, shoe-shiner, yam hawker, or taxi driver on the street. They'd all give him a thumbs-up.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Haha. Living his dream, then. Wish I could say that.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: You haven't met Mr. Liang in over ten years?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Nope.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: But he still chose you to deliver this item.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: That it is.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Then your bond must deserve a thumbs-up as well.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: I'm not experienced enough to say what this portends. I only know by Mr. Liang's expression that this is no laughing matter.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Hardly. I wouldn't dare flaunt any grand bond with your 'Mr. Liang.' But Liang Xun, the man? He's a friend.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: A friend, you say?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: And a good one.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: A good friend is hard enough to find, much less one that will stay so after ten years apart.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: What about you, Master Shen?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: What about me?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: With so many ferrymen at the docks, didn't it seem strange I chose you in particular?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: No. I was briefed by Mr. Liang, so I assumed you were too. I have no need for the details.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: I had to steal this thing right out of a smuggler's hands for old Mr. Liang. Took some effort.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I didn't ask. You must have been itching to speak.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: I came all this way with no one to talk to. You bet I'm itchy.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I'm surprised you trust Liang, what with that cold look on his face. Most people don't.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Ah. You trust him because he's your friend. I do because he's the magistrate of Shangshu.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Do you know him well?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I do. Mr. Liang is good to us, so we return the favor.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: How long have you been in this business, Master Shen?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Hard to say... Who counts out the passing years on their fingers? Twenty? Thirty?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Very admirable.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I'm only a boatman, what's there to admire? Lately they've been putting engines on the boats. Maybe I'll be out of a job in a few years.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: They'll still need someone to navigate the route and keep watch on the sky. I figure as long as there are waterways and the years run long, boatmen and Catastrophe Messengers are in the same boat.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Catastrophes, you say.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: You don't see one often, but when you do, you never forget.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Have you seen one before?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: I have, but also things even more frightening. Not on the rivers, mind you—wait, what have you got me saying?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Hm.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Strange. Two foreigners, it seems.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Alright, two guests?
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Two guests.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: So this is your 'reputation exceptional, dishes quintessential, service congenial, treatment all-equal' Xingyu Inn, then?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: But of course, but of course. My master had nothing but praise for the 'Xingyu' name, so while I've never been graced with a chance to visit Shangshu, I just had to take you here, benefactor.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Ah, but...
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: But?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Heh, it shames me to admit, but my master praised only the name, not any particular amenity. So I am also ignorant as to its precise forte.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Here's your tea.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Just refreshments, or will you two be needing lodging too?
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Wow, they've even got the standard line, huh?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Hey, listen here. Maybe we've only been open for a few years, but trace the name 'Xingyu' back and you'll see it's got a century's worth of fame.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Benefactor, we've been searching for lodging, the prices are suitable enough, and it's not far from the northern crossing we agreed to meet at. What say you?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: I'm fine with whatever.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Then two rooms, please.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Allllright then. Anything to eat for now?
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: May I ask what you have?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Our recommended set meals are on the signs. We're currently on the afternoon menu. If you need anything, just shout.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Very well, let's see...
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: This one looks alright, mate. Lot of Yan flavor in that name.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: The extra-spicy fowl blood curd set...? I'd recommend refraining for now.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Why? When in Londinium, right? Can't hurt to try.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: In my experience, such dishes don't quite... mesh with the lunchtime sensibilities a Rim Billitonian such as yourself might be accustomed to.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: That so? I think I'm pretty good with spice, myself.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: What are you sneaking peeks at?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Look there, at the proprietor. The innkeeper, I wager.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: What about him?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: He's a force to be reckoned with.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: A force how?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Of course, he has to be, with a business this grand. But there's something more than that...
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Are those calluses on his hands?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Your vision is as astounding as ever, benefactor!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: And there's been two guests on the floor upstairs eyeing us ever since we walked in.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: What part of them's caught your eye?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Well... that Cautus seems oddly familiar...
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Are you staying here today, boss? Not heading to check out the other side of the crossing?
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: No, I'm expecting someone. I must be here to attend to this guest.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Heh, you're offering personal service? Gotta be a big shot then. Are we open for business then? How much can we make?
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: There might not be money in it. No shortage of things to settle, though.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Is it about the business over there?
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Yes and no.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: What does THAT mean?
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Less blabbering, more greeting the customers.
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Pssh, penny-pincher.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Ai, welcome, guests, are you—
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: ...Hmph.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Miss Du? What are you—
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: None of your business. Out of the way.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Hey!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Why—what a formidable greeting, young lady. Are you looking for me?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: A sloppy man with glasses, a gaudy outfit, and the look of a swindler.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: So it's gotta be you, right?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Er... I must say that appraisal is a little...
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: An enemy of yours?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: No, they'd never go so far as to send a little girl to do their bidding...
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Who's a little girl, huh?!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: (She kicked up an entire wooden chair—what leg technique!)
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Hmph. You have quick reflexes, dodging without getting up.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Miss, Miss!
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: What? Can't you see I'm busy—
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: This guy's a Liberi, right? Didn't the letter say we were looking for a Lung?
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: Then it's the one upstairs. It's you, right, isn't it?!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Hey now, don't I deserve at least an apology?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Cool it, mate... Hm?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Personally, I thought my attire was just dandy.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Given her approach, I doubt she means well.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: You stroll in and abuse an innocent chair, not to mention almost giving that man a concussion for no reason.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Give it up, your cover's blown. Now play nice and hand it over.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Hmph. I'll grant that it takes guts to sneak into the city in broad daylight though.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Miss Du, was it? I believe there might be a misunderstanding.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Did you come from Lungmen?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Er, yes.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Are you carrying an antique wine cup with you?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Then you have one minute to think up a good excuse. After that, you're handing it over and coming with me.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: The young lady's not too keen on hearing people out... Really makes me miss those kids of mine back home. They'd know better.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Don't look at me. Mr. Liang explained that he specifically entrusted you with bringing that wine cup from Lungmen.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: And if Mr. Liang says so, I believe it.
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: Well, Master Shen, thanks for the vote of confidence.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Odd though... This girl's bold enough to openly say she wants something that Mr. Liang requested?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: One of our aunties plucked this right from a child smuggler's hands, so if you were expecting any legal formalities... haha.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Is the cup noteworthy?
attributes.name: Boatman

attributes.content: I looked into it, there's only baseless legends. Rumors the smugglers heard from the locals.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: *Sigh*. How did this become such a hassle?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: (Nothing, mate, I've seen this in a movie before!)
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: (As have I! But they'd usually call the officers at this point. They'd never jump into a fight, right...?)
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Hey, enough muttering! Got your excuse ready?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: (The lady is certainly blessed with a loud voice... Might those two upstairs be suspects of a sort, then?)
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: (Benefactor?)
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: (Mate. I... I think that guy looks familiar.)
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: (What? The fellow with the remarkably similar get-up to mine?)
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: (No... It can't be... They work with Rhodes Island. Guess there's a little resemblance though?)
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: How about this, young lady? You've caught me, fair and square. Nowhere to run. Now, if you'd call the police...
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Stalling for time, huh? Alright. I was wondering how long you could anyway.
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Get up there!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Don't let him get away!
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: A moment, please!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: What, you want to pay me back for earlier?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Stand down, let me finish my business, and I'll pay for two days of lodging, all expenses. Sound good?
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Take a good, long look Benefactor. If we've not got the wrong person, then a wonderful opportunity has landed in our laps.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: Mr. Lee...?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Let's see... little blonde rabbit, ambiguously closed eyes... a Rhodes Island operator?
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Miraculous. Of the taverns in Shangshu, in all of Yan, in all the world, to think you'd have the fortune to run into an old friend here.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: So how about we not sour the mood on this miraculous reunion?
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: What the hell is going on?! You're all together?!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Surround them! Nobody leaves until they hand over the booty!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Oh? What inspired this?
I dreamt of the fable of the shadow's shadow counseling its shade, and this is my response.
Then I'd like to see it. How do you plan to let these common objects manifest themselves?
Take it as but an inadvertent act. Mock me not for it.
What the... just now...
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Benefactor, watch out!
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: They're all civvies. Keep a light touch.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Careful, that Liberi's from some martial school! Leave the Cautus to me—huh? Where'd she go?
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: Why's it always punch first, ask questions later...?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Wh-When did she get on the second floor?!
attributes.name: Street Youth

attributes.content: No need to hurt anyone, Nothing, mate. Easy does it.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Over here, Mr. Lee.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: *Sigh* So sorry to get you all caught up in this mess.
attributes.name: Lee

attributes.content: Not like we expected to run into you, Mr. Lee. Well, uh, let's get out of here first.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Hey—! Are you ignoring me on purpose?! You think you can just leave?!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: Apologies, but you won't be passing.
attributes.name: Mr. Nothing

attributes.content: And who're you to decide?!
attributes.name: Miss Du

attributes.content: A fan? That swindler... uh, no, that guest knows some rare kung fu, doesn't he?
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Zheng? Sir? Shouldn't you step in before they ruin all the furniture on the ground floor?
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: Fan man's moves are probably meant to intimidate. He's being very slick about it. But the lady hasn't shown us everything yet either. If they work things out, we all come out richer and happier.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: While she's still being cautious, at least.
attributes.name: Inn Assistant

attributes.content: Hey!
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: All you fine people!
attributes.name: Innkeeper Zheng

attributes.content: In the late evenings of Shangshu's early spring, the wind arrives on time while the rain is no guarantee. So it has always been.
A man lifts his head to the skies. The clouds and mist furl, Hui and Ming waver, but at the furthest ends, one can faintly see the light of day.
A spring chill hangs, and a light breeze flutters their clothes.
He should be here by now.
attributes.name: Unfrivolous Man

attributes.content: I do hope that things conclude smoothly.
attributes.name: Unfrivolous Man
